Exaggeration: The claim may be exaggerating the number of Americans killed in mass shootings in 2015.
Lack enough support: The claim may not provide enough evidence or data to support the stated number of Americans killed in mass shootings.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all mass shootings in 2015 resulted in American deaths, which may not be accurate.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or factors that contribute to the number of Americans killed in mass shootings in 2015, which are not mentioned in the claim.
